description: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PEDV), a swine enteropathogenic coronavirus (CoV), is the etiological agent of porcine epidemic diarrhea (PED) that causes an acute and highly contagious enteric disease of swine characterized by vomiting, diarrhea, dehydration, and anorexia in pigs of all ages, especially resulting in severe diarrhea and high mortality rate in piglets.
name: Porcine Epidemic Diarrhea Virus Antibodies and Antigens
